captions.text:
unknown untill it was spotted first by fishermen
of the coast of indonesia in the 1990's
it looked like an octopus
but it could more fit shape in an instant
to appear as seemingly any animal around it
at first no one had any idea what it was
the first time i saw it i just was blown away
you couldn't get them all spectacular animal
it really is the pinnacle of wizardry

biologist mark norman was the first scientist
to study this seemingly shapeless creature
he named it the mimic actopus

the mimic octopus makes it self look like
a living moving animal

so it pulls all that arms around
behind its body
and swims along like a poisonous flat fish
in others cases if it's getting attacked

it puts six arms down a hole
and rises the other two arms
to look like the poisonous sea snake
that had bands along its body

if tha's not enough he'd swim along
like a poisonous lion fish
with these banded arms looking like

the banded spines
that come off this very deadly fish

so far 15 separate species are known
to be in the mimic octopus act

and norman is not always sure
exactly what the mimic is doing
he observed this mimic scuttling along the sea bottom

looking something like a
furry turkey with human legs

somethimes it's hard
when you watch a mimic octopus

doing what it does
to interpret what's going on

it's a bit like at ink spots
in a psychiatrist office
going a... i don't know what it is
it could be a piano, it could be a fridge
so he gets three or four diverse to gather

and you will argue it or not
trying to work at what we think of what's mimicing
where did nature's greatest actor come from?

title: Most intelligent Mimic Octopus in the world

comments.author: rainmaker6261

comments.text:
+Elayna Johnson Well thanks to Earth we have shelter, energy, food, 
everything we need. I don't think we're killing it, we're just using it up 
at an exponential rate. Meaning, we must collect valuable resources from 
other bodies in space so we don't purely depend on our resources from Earth 
cause we all know we will eventually deplete Earth of its resources if we 
don't find another source of resources. But then again, we are finding new 
sources of energy which are renewable. If we didn't use the resources we 
needed from Earth, then we probably wouldn't be so technologically advanced 
& powerful. There just has to be a limit, like not cutting down all trees, 
not making bees go extinct, not using up all the oil, etc. Just things that 
would kill the Earth. Also, wasn't the fukushima disaster an accident?
comments.author: Cambo 100

comments.text:
+Cambo 100​ Yes, I'm well aware of that. But those aren't 'mistakes'. We 
know that we're killing our planet, and, to be honest, I could go without 
technology if it means saving the beautiful parts of nature we have left. ( 
And I mean the parts where man hasn't built anything, hasn't changed 
anything, or altered it in any way.)
comments.author: Elayna Johnson

comments.text:
+Elayna Johnson There are billions of people on Earth, not all will do 
good; Plus, mistakes happen. Instead of looking at all the negative 
aspects, why don't you look at the positive aspects. Such as exponential 
improvement of technology, more countries are becoming more industrialized, 
we may even see space exploration within some or most of our lifetime and 
water is actually way more common in our galaxy than we thought! Im sure 
the positive aspects of humans outweigh the negative aspects. Overtime we 
will become smarter & wiser, and I believe we as humans will do well in the 
universe.
comments.author: Cambo 100

comments.text:
+Cambo 100​ Our " advancement in life " includes destroying habitats, 
polluting our air and water, and basically killing our planet slowly.

comments.author: joshua jordan

comments.text:
+LordofFullmetal
1. We are frail because we evolved all our energy to go into our brain, not 
our physical strength. 
2. We are superior because we figured out how to escape the food chain and 
live 3 times longer.
3. Sharks have evolved longer then us but have not outlived us yet and 
cannot out-survive us.
4. We are the only species that have the potential to make all life on this 
planet immortal by preparing for this planets inevitable destruction.
5. We are the only species that attempts to preserve the others.
6. Most other animals have no thoughts of mercy or selflessness.
7. Any animal that leaves the food chain and triples it's lifespan is bound 
to ruin it's environment.

Other animals are only "better" then us because they are considered 
innocent. They are only considered innocent because they are not 
intelligent enough to be held accountable for anything.
comments.author: Emanyt Tihsa

comments.text:
+LordofFullmetal We're the superior species because of our technology & 
advancement in life. We have much power over other animals because of our 
technology. We will find a more sufficient and renewable resource that can 
be replaced for gas, oil, etc. Technology is exponentially becoming better. 
Don't know why you are thinking like that but no doubt, we are the superior 
species of this planet. We can be considered the inferior species if 
monkeys & apes start taking over and become powerful & superior. But right 
now, we hold that position.
comments.author: Cambo 100

comments.text:
+Johnny Utah
You know that by ignoring my warnings you're hurting YOURSELF, not me, 
right? There's no way you're stupid enough to think this in ANY way 
benefits you. If not, feel free to say goodbye to your account because what 
you're doing is against terms of service and I am HAPPY to report every 
single comment.
comments.author: LordofFullmetal

comments.text:
+Johnny Utah
Good, keep insulting me. Allows me to keep reporting you, and makes you 
look worse and worse.
 Three strikes of harassment and your account's GONE. Wanna keep going? 
It'll only hurt you in the end.
comments.author: LordofFullmetal

comments.text:
+Johnny Utah
The fact that you felt the need to use the word retard shows that I am more 
intelligent than you. If you actually HAD any argument against me, you 
would have given it rather than making yourself look like an idiot by using 
a word that is not only incorrect, but not socially acceptable and that 
makes you look like an ASSHOLE. On top of that, you insulting me has now 
given me an excuse to report you.
I honestly cannot think of any sentence you could possibly have used that 
was MORE self defeating. Thanks for helping me win; you just made me look 
even more right.
 Now that you've said that, NO ONE is going to take anything you have to 
say seriously.
comments.author: LordofFullmetal

comments.text:
+Cambo 100
As said BY a human. Of COURSE we see ourselves as superior. But seriously, 
we're not. We die more easily than most other animals, our babies are more 
helpless for longer than most other animals, and we can't even say that our 
intelligence is one of a kind any more because there are so MANY animals 
that come scarily close to our level of intelligence. We have opposable 
thumbs. That's the difference. Stop being so up yourself.
Even assuming there is NO other creature as smart as us, saying that makes 
us superior is like saying a pig is superior to a cat or dog (pigs are more 
intelligent than both). That's not a measure of superiority by itself, and 
it's ALL we have going for us. Besides that, even that intelligence is 
starting to fade. We're devolving as a species. Humans are getting LESS 
intelligent.

If you wanna go by world domination, we're NOTHING. Crocodiles, sharks and 
squid have all been around since pretty much the beginning of TIME, and 
we're still afraid of sharks. I'd say that makes SHARKS the superior 
species. They pose a threat to us. They were around millions of years 
before us and they'll be around when we're gone. Dinosaurs, some of which 
were pretty stupid, ruled over the Earth for millions of years longer than 
humans have, and to a much larger degree. Keep in mind we're still only 
land animals.

Add to that the fact that our planet is actively telling us to FUCK OFF. 
We've treated it so badly we're starting to set off nature's defence 
mechanisms. That's not the behaviour of a "superior species".
Human beings SUCK. We're arrogant, we're selfish, we're stupid and we're 
absolutely no better than any other species.
comments.author: LordofFullmetal

comments.text: We are still the superior species of this planet.
